p.meaning: Lookback window length for the time-lagged causal relations
p.expert_suggestion: Use 2 as default. Chosen value can be dtermined by preprocessing steps

lambda_w.meaning: parameter for l1 regularisation of intra-slice edges
lambda_w.expert_suggestion: Use 0.01 as default. Higher values promote sparser graphs, lower values allow more connections.

lambda_a.meaning: parameter for l1 regularisation of inter-slice edges
lambda_a.expert_suggestion: Use 0.01 as default. Higher values promote sparser graphs, lower values allow more connections.

max_iter.meaning: Maximum number of dual ascent steps during optimization
max_iter.expert_suggestion: Use 100 as default. Increase for more complex graphs or if convergence is slow.

w_threshold.meaning: Threshold for edge weights in adjacency matrix
w_threshold.expert_suggestion: Use 0.05 as default. Higher values lead to sparser graphs by pruning weak connections - higher value for less no of nodes and short lag
